name: Open IE
tagline: Quality information extraction at web scale.
body:
### Description

Open IE is an open information extractor that find relationships in sentence.  Here is an example sentence and extractions:

> U.S. president Barack Obama gave his inaugural address on January 20, 2013.
```
(Barack Obama; is president of; U.S.)
(Barack Obama; gave; [his inaugural address, on January 20, 2013])
```

In this example, the second part of the tuple is the relationship between the first argument and the second arguments.

### Releases

* v4.1 ([binaries](http://knowitall.cs.washington.edu/openie/release/openie-4.1.jar)) ([javadocs](http://knowitall.cs.washington.edu/openie/javadoc/v4.1))
* v4.0 ([binaries](http://knowitall.cs.washington.edu/openie/release/openie-4.0.jar)) ([javadocs](http://knowitall.cs.washington.edu/openie/javadoc/v4.0))

### Data

### Versions

There have been several versions of Open IE in the past that are different combinations of subsystems.

* Open IE 4.0 is composed of [Srlie](https://github.com/knowitall/srlie) and [Relnoun](https://github.com/knowitall/chunkedextractor).
* Open IE 3.0 used to be known as [Ollie](https://github.com/knowitall/ollie).
* Open IE 2.0 is also known as [ReVerb](https://github.com/knowitall/reverb).
* Open IE 1.0 is also known as [TextRunner](http://acl.ldc.upenn.edu/N/N07/N07-4013.pdf).

### License

Open IE is licensed under a [University of Washington Academic License](https://raw.github.com/knowitall/openie/master/LICENSE).

### Credits

Open IE was authored and developed by the following people at the University of Washington's Turing Center as part of the KnowItAll Project:

* [Anthony Fader](http://homes.cs.washington.edu/~afader/)
* [Mausam](https://homes.cs.washington.edu/~mausam/)
* [Michael Schmitz](http://wiki.schmitztech.com/)
* [Michele Banko](http://www.linkedin.com/in/mbanko)
* [Michael Cafarella](http://web.eecs.umich.edu/~michjc/)
* [Oren Etzioni](http://homes.cs.washington.edu/~etzioni/)
* [Robert Bart](https://github.com/rbart)
* [Stephen Soderland](http://homes.cs.washington.edu/~soderlan/)
